list.name: Changes
list.comment:
feat(user-service): implement domain and infrastructure layers with sqlc
- Create User entity with password hashing (bcrypt) - Define UserRepository interface in domain layer - Implement PostgresUserRepository using sqlc-generated code - Add UUID conversion between domain (string) and database (uuid.UUID) - Create database schema with users table and indexes - Write type-safe SQL queries for all CRUD operations - Add PostgreSQL connection configuration
Clean Architecture: Domain defines interface, Infrastructure implements it using sqlc.

MESSAGE.value:
"feat(user-service): implement domain layer with User entity
- Create User entity with business logic (HashPassword, CheckPassword) - Define UserRepository interface following Repository pattern - Implement user roles (customer, admin) - Add password hashing with bcrypt - Follow Clean Architecture: domain has no external dependencies
Domain layer is framework-agnostic and contains only business rules."

feat(user-service): implement application layer with DTOs and use cases
- Create DTOs for registration, login, and user responses - Implement RegisterUserUseCase with email validation and password hashing - Implement LoginUserUseCase with authentication logic - Add validation rules using binding tags - Separate request/response models from domain entities
Application layer orchestrates domain logic without knowing about HTTP or database details.

feat(user-service): implement domain and infrastructure layers with sqlc
- Create User entity with password hashing (bcrypt) - Define UserRepository interface in domain layer - Implement PostgresUserRepository using sqlc-generated code - Add UUID conversion between domain (string) and database (uuid.UUID) - Create database schema with users table and indexes - Write type-safe SQL queries for all CRUD operations - Add PostgreSQL connection configuration
Clean Architecture: Domain defines interface, Infrastructure implements it using sqlc.
